units.name: ArchaeopterTransvector
units.flavour: Ideal aerial insertion transports, Transvectors are used in vast numbers by Explorator fleets for reconnaissance and rapid extraction in the face of hostiles. They are incredibly agile, their implanted pilots able to reshape the wings to suit changing atmospherics, while directing their cognis heavy stubbers to scythe apart oncoming foes.

units.name: ArchaeopterStratoraptor
units.flavour: The Stratoraptor takes advantage of the Archaeopter’s directional thrusters and adaptable wing profile to excel in the role of ground attack gunship. Its spread of heavy weapons – with a mixture of high strength and high rate of fire – ensures the Stratoraptor poses a lethal danger to dug-in infantry and heavily armoured vehicles alike.

units.name: CyberneticaDatasmith
units.description: Canticles of the Omnissiah infantry unit that repairs Adeptus Mechanicus units, reprograms Kastelan Robots, clears tiles and founds new cities.
units.flavour: Datasmiths optimise the programming of their robotic charges. These Tech-Priests employ rituals and binharic hymns to bless the doctrina wafers through which they alter the robots’ protocols, all the while laying waste to the enemies of the Omnissiah with blasts of ionizing radiation from their gamma pistols.

units.name: FulguriteElectroPriest
units.description: Canticles of the Omnissiah melee infantry unit that increases its damage reduction by killing units.
units.flavour: Fulgurite Electro-Priests crackle with the life energies of those they have personally slain. Their quest is to locate the Motive Force that animates all things, rip it from the bodies of the unworthy in the heat of battle, and hoard it on behalf of the Machine God. To do so they use electroleech staves – eldritch weapons that suck the bioelectricity from living creatures, drawing it out in one great draught and harnessing it within their core capacitors. Once stolen, that sacred energy can be used to power the holy instead of the heretical, crackling around them in such measure it can even burn away incoming projectiles.

units.name: Headquarters
units.description: Headquarters unit that represents a city's defenses.
units.flavour: The Forge Temple is the centre of the Adeptus Mechanicus’ presence on a world. Is it a citadel of information, a repository of the remnants of humanity’s long-cherished knowledge… or the headquarters of a fanatical cult dedicated to hoarding information that could save humanity? To even think the latter would, of course, be heresy…

units.name: KataphronDestroyer
units.description: Canticles of the Omnissiah infantry unit with devastating anti-armour weaponry.
units.flavour: Lobotomised to ensure unswerving faith, Kataphron Destroyers stray not one iota from the path allocated to them – that of holy annihilator. The minds of these servants of the Omnissiah have been filled with thoughts of war alone. Their limbs have been excised and cast aside to make room for arcane weapons that just like battering rams from their shoulders. These centauroid cyborgs have been fashioned with more than brute force in mind, however, for each is a minor artillery piece in its own right.

units.name: IronstriderBallistarius
units.flavour: Ironstrider Ballistarii are peerless marksmen. Stalking at the fringes of each Skitarii maniple, the Ballistarii hunt down enemy commanders and spiritual leaders, knowing that to slay such individuals is an efficient way to degrade the enemy’s operative capabilities. Equally capable of disabling the war engines of the enemy, these unmatched riflemen will trample down those who block their passage until they have the perfect vantage point for their shot.

units.name: KnightCrusader
units.description: Super-heavy walker unit with an endless array of deadly ranged weapons.
units.flavour: Finding the optimal firing position, the Knight Crusader locks down its motive actuators in preparation to unleash a punishing salvo. From its avenger gatling cannon it levels a fusillade of heavy shells, sketching deadly patterns across the enemy army’s frontage. Those that are equipped with Icarus autocannons on their shoulders are given an additional duty: to protect their comrades from airborne attack. Swivelling in response to their predictive auto-auguries, the Icarus cannons spit streams of flakk fire into the skies to detonate enemy aircraft in distant fireballs. With each section of the battlefield it clears of foes, the Crusader’s steady advance brings new targets under its sights, and it continues to unleash destruction with every stride.

units.name: OnagerDunecrawler
units.description: Doctrina Imperatives walker unit focused on exterminating flying units.
units.flavour: Onager Dunecrawlers decimate the foes of the Skitarii whilst channelling great swathes of battlefield information to their masters high above. Squadrons of these versatile walkers clank to war in long columns that stalk forwards in uncanny unison, clambering over shattered ruins and wading through toxic run-off without breaking stride. The enemies of the Cult Mechanicus have good reason to fear the Dunecrawler, for these ornate monsters are protected by overlapping emanatus force fields, and bear some of the most esoteric and destructive tank-portable weaponry the Tech-Priests can devise.

units.name: PteraxiiSterylizor
units.description: Doctrina Imperatives infantry unit that can jump over enemies and burn them out of cover.
units.flavour: Sterylizors are eradicators of cybernetic parasite organisms within ships and manufactora, and eagerly unleash the chemical fire of their phosphor torches upon the Machine God’s foes. They descend in flocks from the sky upon membranous wing-packs, their vicious talons primed, eager to see their enemies writhe in flames.

units.name: SkitariiMarshal
units.description: Doctrina Imperative hero unit that leads the Adeptus Mechanicus into battle.
units.flavour: Marshals lead the maniples and cohorts of Skitarii soldiery. They are veteran warriors of countless crusades, privileged to bear enhanced augmentations. Marshals stand as intermediaries between Skitarii formations and their priestly masters, employing sacred uplinks to refine their warriors’ doctrines closer to holy perfection.

units.name: SicarianInfiltrator
units.description: Doctrina Imperatives infantry unit that specializes in infiltrating enemy lines.
units.flavour: Those hunted by Sicarian Infiltrators will find themselves buffeted by the waves of neurostatic these gangle-limbed stalkers broadcast before them. Robbed of their sight, their hearing, even their sense of smell, such victims are easy targets for the compact tools the Infiltrators use in their deadly work. Should the initial salvo from flechette blaster or stubcarbine not prove sufficient, these merciless killers will dart in to finish the job in close assault.

units.name: SkitariiVanguard
units.description: Basic Doctrina Imperatives infantry unit with radium weapons and an aura that cripples enemy infantry and monstrous creatures.
units.flavour: The Vanguard of the Skitarii cohorts are feared throughout the Imperium, for they use the baleful energies of the forge worlds as their weapon. Equipped with pack generators that bleed potent energy by-products, these Omnissian martyrs are so saturated in radiation that even to approach them is to succumb to their peculiar curse. Their baroque carbines fill the air around the foe with harmful emanations, corrupting the atmosphere itself even as they punch hyper-irradiated shot into the flesh of their victims.

units.name: SkorpiusDisintegrator
units.description: Powerful Doctrina Imperatives front-line tank unit.
units.flavour: Hovering over the ruins of war on a bed of atomised gases, Skorpius Disintegrators are archaic, front-line battle tanks. They surge forward in unstoppable armoured waves and support infantry advances, maintaining blistering salvoes of fire to cripple enemy war engines and sweep aside hordes of lesser foes.

units.name: SkorpiusDunerider
units.flavour: Skorpius Duneriders enable forge lords to ferry squads of their cyborg infantry onto the front lines, overwhelming the foe through swiftly redeployed weight of numbers. Duneriders sweep onto enemy defences in a cloud of chemical smoke, saturating the area with heavy calibre shot as their payload of warriors disembarks.

units.name: TechPriestDominus
units.description: Self-reliant Canticles of the Omnissiah hero unit with a scouting ability and damage buffs.
units.flavour: Slithering, floating, stalking with avian gait, the Tech-Priests Dominus scour their surroundings with carrion eagerness. Ever vigilant for lost treasures they can pluck from the corpses of the worlds they conquer, their minds boil hot with data, and their spines are bent under the immense weight of knowledge they have torn from an unwilling universe. Despite their crooked appearance, these warrior magi are amongst the deadliest and most determined of all the Omnissiah’s hunters.

units.name: TechPriestManipulus
units.description: Canticles of the Omnissiah hero unit with powerful support abilities and neutralizing effects.
units.flavour: Among the augmentations of a Tech-Priest Manipulus is a galvanic cell from which they channel powerful charges of the Motive Force. They drain power sources dry and use the energy to overcharge the cells of their warriors’ armaments, all while defending their divine work with blasts from their own arcane weapons.

units.name: SerberysSulphurhound
units.description: Doctrina Imperatives infantry unit with flame weapons and an aura that cripples enemy infantry and monstrous creatures.
units.flavour: Sulphurhound cavalry squadrons are aggressive shock troops and line-breakers. The loping, mechanical beasts breathe gouts of incinerating phosphor and disembowel the foe with slashing claws, while the elite Skitarii riders unload incandescent pistol fire as they smash through defence lines, before circling back for survivors.

buildings.name: Aircraft
buildings.description: Building that produces aircraft as well as generates food, ore and influence.
buildings.flavour: An Archaeoptera is just yet another Adeptus Mechanicus construction facility, albeit for flying machines rather than terrestrial. It has all the usual elements—the massed slave labour to build the machines, the medical facilities for all the amputations the pilots need to fit in, and the shrines to conduct the proper rituals over the Transvectors and Stratoraptors. In other words, a totally normal Tech-Priest manufactorum.

buildings.name: Construction
buildings.description: Building that constructs new buildings as well as generates food, ore and influence.
buildings.flavour: The simple title of ‘artisan’ conceals the immensity of what these Tech-Priests achieve. Not personally, of course, but through vast labour forces of mind-wiped servitors. Here, in the Constructorum, this army of once-men build the buildings and tools to enable the Tech-Priest’s efforts elsewhere.

buildings.name: Energy
buildings.flavour: After millennia of inhabitation, Gladius Prime is a trove of ancient technology, much active and embedded deep in its crust. Alongside that, the planet’s core is still active with roiling magma. The Thermo-Exchanger Shrines use arcane technology and ritual to tap the planet’s restless heaving and gather that energy for use elsewhere.

buildings.name: Headquarters
buildings.flavour: The Forge Temple is the centre of the Adeptus Mechanicus’ presence on a world. Is it a citadel of information, a repository of the remnants of humanity’s long-cherished knowledge… or the headquarters of a fanatical cult dedicated to hoarding information that could save humanity? To even think the latter would, of course, be heresy…

buildings.name: Heroes
buildings.description: Building that produces tech-priests as well as increases population limit and loyalty.
buildings.flavour: A Sub-Cloister serves as a shelter and school for new Tech-Priests. Here, promising acolytes from the planet’s hive cities are trained in the many secrets of the Cult Mechanicus. Over time, if they survive, they find their calling, emerging as lowly Enginseers, fanatical Electro-Priests, cybernetic Data-Smiths or any of a myriad other non-combat specialisations.

buildings.name: Food
buildings.flavour: The Adeptus Mechanicus are not famed for their love of the pleasures of the flesh and it is a rare Tech-Priest who would admit to being a gourmet of anything but code. That is reflected in these repurposed Ferratonic Furnaces, or rather their dietary output. Its rations are calibrated to be the most efficient medium for transferring the absolute minimum energy and resources for an average person to survive and function.

buildings.name: Housing
buildings.flavour: It is hard to think of an alien race that might approve of a Hive World’s living conditions—perhaps the subterranean Hrud. Yet to the Adeptus Mechanicus, they are ideal. They seek to replicate their efficiency in their own housing units, cramming workers, servitors and skitarii into living quarters so tight that violence would seem assured—were it not for behavioural engineering and surgery.

buildings.name: Infantry
buildings.description: Building that produces infantry as well as generates food, ore and influence.
buildings.flavour: To say that the Astra Militarum training academies ‘produce’ soldiers would offend any Tech-Priest’s logic centres. Even the lowliest acolyte knows that humans are just one raw material in the production of effective soldiers, with circuits, bio-plastic and metal comprising a larger proportion of most Skitarii. After all, “flesh is fallible”!

buildings.name: Influence
buildings.flavour: To anyone else, it is machine noise—whirring and beeping and grinding. But to the receptors of an augmented Adeptus Mechanicus subject, it is a combination of choral evensong, elegant symphony and fervent prayer to the glory of the Omnissiah and the rightness of His servants, the Adeptus Mechanicus. Struck with an infoload of revelation, truly blessed Tech-Priests will override the sacred canticles to deliver the Machine God’s adaptive wisdom.

buildings.name: Loyalty
buildings.flavour: Of course, there is dissent in the Imperium. Even in the Adeptus Mechanicus, hidebound as it is, there is disagreement over the best path to follow. And this is all productive, useful discord. For were there not heretics, there would not the requisite human raw materials to produce servitors and servo-skulls, to set up as examples to craven humanity as to what happens to those who stray from the Omnissiah’s Path.

buildings.name: Vehicles
buildings.description: Building that produces ground vehicles as well as generates food, ore and influence.
buildings.flavour: A Tech-Priest manufactorum is leagues ahead of its standard Imperial equivalent. Not technologically, of course—the Cult Mechanicus considers it more important to safeguard the technology they have and improving it is a Xenarite heresy that only Cawl himself might consider. Instead this building has superior rituals, unguents, chants, libations and so forth.

buildings.name: Ore
buildings.flavour: This complicated installation is understood fully by few Tech-Priests, but can be repurposed to many functions. In the absence of Adeptus Administratum manpower, to physically extract the ore, the Adeptus Mechanicus falls back on approved ancient techniques—retargetting the Reactor’s plasma output onto ore veins to extract and refine the metals they contain.

buildings.name: Research
buildings.flavour: Named in honour of the continent-spanning data repository buried beneath the surface of Mars, each local Librarium contains a tiny fraction of the surviving knowledge of mankind, much of which was disordered or corrupted during the Schism of Mars. Many Tech-Priests dedicate their lives (and lose them) exploring these secrets in the hope of rediscovering ancient knowledge or even—Omnissiah willing—an STC.

upgrades.name: AdjacencyIntegration
upgrades.description: Increases the building research output for each building in an adjacent tile.
upgrades.flavour: The rediscovery of knowledge is such a holy rite, that supporting rites have been mandated throughout the Hive. As population density grows, the faithful constantly pour libations and imprecate the city’s integrated machine spirits to give up their secrets to the Tech-Priests in the Librarium Omnis.

upgrades.name: Aircraft
upgrades.description: Building that produces aircraft as well as generates food, ore and influence.
upgrades.flavour: An Archaeoptera is just yet another Adeptus Mechanicus construction facility, albeit for flying machines rather than terrestrial. It has all the usual elements—the massed slave labour to build the machines, the medical facilities for all the amputations the pilots need to fit in, and the shrines to conduct the proper rituals over the Transvectors and Stratoraptors. In other words, a totally normal Tech-Priest manufactorum.

upgrades.name: ArchaeopterStratoraptor
upgrades.description: Doctrina Imperatives flying combat unit.
upgrades.flavour: The Stratoraptor takes advantage of the Archaeopter’s directional thrusters and adaptable wing profile to excel in the role of ground attack gunship. Its spread of heavy weapons – with a mixture of high strength and high rate of fire – ensures the Stratoraptor poses a lethal danger to dug-in infantry and heavily armoured vehicles alike.

upgrades.name: AggressorImperative
upgrades.description: Increases the movement, but decreases the armour of Doctrina Imperatives units. Cost scales with the amount of affected units (up to 10).
upgrades.flavour: The Skitarii feel the press of an invisible hand upon their minds as the Machine God drives them forward. Servos are pushed to their structural limits as fibre bundles fill with the boundless energy of the Motive Force and propel the faithful on an unstoppable crusade.

upgrades.name: AssaultWeaponBonus
upgrades.description: Increases the armour penetration of assault weapons.
upgrades.flavour: The zealots of Metalica are famed for bringing with them an ear-shattering clamour, redolent of their forge world’s endless industry—and for not pausing in their relentless advance, obliterating their foes mid-march.

upgrades.name: BenedictionOfOmniscience
upgrades.description: Increases the ranged accuracy of Canticles of the Omnissiah units. Cost and effectiveness scales with the amount of affected units (up to 10).
upgrades.flavour: Those blessed enough to comprehend this blaring vox-prayer find their targeting reticules guided by the Omnissiah’s own vigilance.

upgrades.name: BlessedConduits
upgrades.description: Reduces the cooldown of Power Surge.
upgrades.flavour:
“And when at last he came upon the vehicle, he perceived the distress of the engine therein and forthwith struck the rune and it was good. Thereupon the engine ignited and was filled with strength…“
—Lord of the Engines, 16th Tome, Verse 2001

upgrades.name: BroadSpectrumDataTether
upgrades.description: Ability for Ironstride Ballistarii, Skorpius Dunerider, Onager Dunecrawler and Skorpius Disintegrator that reduces the morale loss of adjacent Adeptus Mechanicus units.
upgrades.flavour: A vehicle-mounted version of that carried by veteran Skitarii, the broad spectrum datatether projects a Tech-Priest’s binharic blurts with such clarity it seems he is amongst the ranks of the Skitarii himself. Imperatives delivered via such information relays are more potent and reliable than any other.

upgrades.name: ChantOfTheRemorselessFist
upgrades.description: Increases the melee accuracy of Canticles of the Omnissiah units. Cost and effectiveness scales with the amount of affected units (up to 10).
upgrades.flavour: In spitting out a staccato chant to the Motive Force, the faithful warriors of the Cult Mechanicus are filled with merciless surety as well as intent.

upgrades.name: BulwarkImperative
upgrades.description: Increases the armour, but decreases the movement of Doctrina Imperatives units. Cost scales with the amount of affected units (up to 10).
upgrades.flavour: The warrior wisdom of ancient and experienced Reductors is force-loaded into the Skitarii’s minds. Each thrilling pulse of data locks microactuators into bracing positions, brings reserve power cells online and bestows a sensation of sacred invulnerability upon the Tech-Priests’ soldiers.

upgrades.name: CityTier2
upgrades.description: Increases the tile acquisition radius.
upgrades.flavour: Terraforming is the ironically-named process of making a planet more livable for humans, exactly unlike the devastated bulk of Earth, hidden beneath the continent-sprawling Imperial Palace. Mavoraforming has no such pretensions, turning a planet into an exploited, poisoned dotted with incredibly productive cities, just like home.

upgrades.name: CityTier3
upgrades.description: Increases the tile acquisition radius.
upgrades.flavour: The final conversion of a planet to a Hive World is visible from space. Gone are the rolling hills, the valleys, the trees. Vanished the lakes, seas and breathable atmosphere. Biting grit blows over dust bowls where a few recalcitrant Imperials eke out subsistence farms in the shadows of sky-piercing Hive spires, filled with billions of souls.

upgrades.name: CognisHeavyStubber
upgrades.description: Grants Onager Dunecrawlers a Cognis Heavy Stubber.
upgrades.flavour: Cognis weaponry, though superficially similar to that used by the rest of the Imperium, has one vital difference – a cognis weapon’s machine spirit has been permanently awakened by the rites of the Machine God. When the wielder is unable to give his full concentration, the warlike spirit of the gun will take over.

upgrades.name: CommandUplink
upgrades.description: Ability for Archaeopter Transvector and Archaeopter Stratoraptor that reduces the morale loss of adjacent Adeptus Mechanicus units.
upgrades.flavour:
“You may feel fear, you may want to flee; but when your Magos can, with a thought, stop your limbs taking a single step back, well, then you fight anyway.”
—Marshal Diktum

upgrades.name: Construction
upgrades.description: Building that constructs new buildings as well as generates food, ore and influence.
upgrades.flavour: The simple title of ‘artisan’ conceals the immensity of what these Tech-Priests achieve. Not personally, of course, but through vast labour forces of mind-wiped servitors. Here, in the Constructorum, this army of once-men build the buildings and tools to enable the Tech-Priest’s efforts elsewhere.

upgrades.name: ConquerorImperative
upgrades.description: Increases the melee accuracy, but decreases the ranged accuracy of Doctrina Imperatives units. Cost scales with the amount of affected units (up to 10).
upgrades.flavour: When the enemy close in, the Tech-Priests controlling each maniple inload Conqueror imperatives that boost the martial subroutines of their Skitarii minions and galvanise them into physical action at the expense of their more elaborate targeting programmes.

upgrades.name: EnhancedDataTether
upgrades.description: Increases the morale of Skitarii Vanguards.
upgrades.flavour: Seen as the mouthpieces of the Tech-Priests, who in turn are the prophets of the Machine God himself, those honoured with bearing enhanced data-tethers are obeyed without hesitation by their reverent Skitarii comrades.

upgrades.name: ExtraInfantryArmour
upgrades.description: Increases the armour of infantry.
upgrades.flavour: The integration of Graian protocols into a Skitarii’s command circuits further enhances their already impressive survivability. The Forge World of Graia is known for its refusal to ever yield, given that their logic is simply irrefutable.

upgrades.name: ExtraVehicleArmour
upgrades.description: Increases the armour of vehicles.
upgrades.flavour: Living by the Eye of Terror after the fall of Cadia has transformed the Adeptus Mechanicus on Agripinaa into defensive experts—particularly, when it comes to keeping their machines running under fire.

upgrades.name: FulguriteElectroPriest
upgrades.description: Canticles of the Omnissiah melee infantry unit that increases its damage reduction by killing units.
upgrades.flavour: Fulgurite Electro-Priests crackle with the life energies of those they have personally slain. Their quest is to locate the Motive Force that animates all things, rip it from the bodies of the unworthy in the heat of battle, and hoard it on behalf of the Machine God. To do so they use electroleech staves – eldritch weapons that suck the bioelectricity from living creatures, drawing it out in one great draught and harnessing it within their core capacitors. Once stolen, that sacred energy can be used to power the holy instead of the heretical, crackling around them in such measure it can even burn away incoming projectiles.

upgrades.name: HammerOfWrath
upgrades.description: Grants Ironstrider Ballistarius, Fulgurite Electro-Priests, Onager Dunecrawler and Knight Crusader the ability to perform more devastating attacks.
upgrades.flavour: Many warriors hurl themselves headlong into combat, seeking to crush or trample the foe.

upgrades.name: HeavyWeaponBonus
upgrades.description: Increases the armour penetration of heavy weapons.
upgrades.flavour: The Ordinati are unique titan-sized devices, each built for a unique purpose and closely guarded. Your researches have unearthed approved teachings taken from the creation of Ordinatus Oberon, a track-mounted starship cannon employed during the Wars for Armageddon.

upgrades.name: FidorumVossPrime
upgrades.description: Increases the building influence output for each building in an adjacent tile.
upgrades.flavour: The Cult Mechanicus Priesthood venerate the Forge World of Voss Prime for its loyalty above all others—its loyalty to the Imperium is second-to-none. Even when Mars itself fell to the Dark Mechanicum, Voss Prime continued to churn out armaments and was instrumental in the defeat of the Horus Heresy.

upgrades.name: Heroes
upgrades.description: Building that produces tech-priests as well as increases population limit and loyalty.
upgrades.flavour: A Sub-Cloister serves as a shelter and school for new Tech-Priests. Here, promising acolytes from the planet’s hive cities are trained in the many secrets of the Cult Mechanicus. Over time, if they survive, they find their calling, emerging as lowly Enginseers, fanatical Electro-Priests, cybernetic Data-Smiths or any of a myriad other non-combat specialisations.

upgrades.name: Housing
upgrades.description: Building that increases population limit.
upgrades.flavour: It is hard to think of an alien race that might approve of a Hive World’s living conditions—perhaps the subterranean Hrud. Yet to the Adeptus Mechanicus, they are ideal. They seek to replicate their efficiency in their own housing units, cramming workers, servitors and skitarii into living quarters so tight that violence would seem assured—were it not for behavioural engineering and surgery.

upgrades.name: IconsOfTheOmnissiah
upgrades.description: Increases the building loyalty output for each building in an adjacent tile.
upgrades.flavour: Protect us, master. Free us, Machine God. The Omnissiah comes. The Omnissiah comes. THE OMNISSIAH COMES. Punish the flesh.

upgrades.name: IncantationOfTheIronSoul
upgrades.description: Reduces the morale loss of Canticles of the Omnissiah units. Cost and effectiveness scales with the amount of affected units (up to 10).
upgrades.flavour: Raising their voices in binharic praise, the Disciples of the Machine God bolster their spirits with the surety of iron.

upgrades.name: KastelanRobot
upgrades.description: Extremely durable and heavily armed Canticles of the Omnissiah combat walker unit.
upgrades.flavour: Kastelan Robots are ancient monstrosities that stamp to war, each an unliving giant assigned a deadly purpose by its master. Soulless, these metallic golems are given thought only by the doctrina wafers in their recessed chestslots and the Cybernetica Datasmiths that program their every move. These machines are walking relics from aeons past, and all the deadlier for it—the air nearby thrums with power, bullets ricocheting from repulsor fields that glow like golden cages around them. Volleys of phosphor blasts and promethium incinerate their foes wherever they may hide, and crushing fists bring ruin wherever they strike. The violence meted out by each maniple is as inspiring to the Omnissiah's faithful as it is terrifying to his foes.

upgrades.name: InvocationOfMachineMight
upgrades.description: Increases the melee damage of Canticles of the Omnissiah units. Cost and effectiveness scales with the amount of affected units (up to 10).
upgrades.flavour: The Tech-Priests lead their minions in a binharic prayer that sends miraculous strength surging through tendons, wires and pistons.

upgrades.name: KataphronDestroyer
upgrades.description: Canticles of the Omnissiah infantry unit with devastating anti-armour weaponry.
upgrades.flavour: Lobotomised to ensure unswerving faith, Kataphron Destroyers stray not one iota from the path allocated to them – that of holy annihilator. The minds of these servants of the Omnissiah have been filled with thoughts of war alone. Their limbs have been excised and cast aside to make room for arcane weapons that just like battering rams from their shoulders. These centauroid cyborgs have been fashioned with more than brute force in mind, however, for each is a minor artillery piece in its own right.

upgrades.name: KnightCrusader
upgrades.description: Super-heavy walker unit with an endless array of deadly ranged weapons.
upgrades.flavour: Finding the optimal firing position, the Knight Crusader locks down its motive actuators in preparation to unleash a punishing salvo. From its avenger gatling cannon it levels a fusillade of heavy shells, sketching deadly patterns across the enemy army’s frontage. Those that are equipped with Icarus autocannons on their shoulders are given an additional duty: to protect their comrades from airborne attack. Swivelling in response to their predictive auto-auguries, the Icarus cannons spit streams of flakk fire into the skies to detonate enemy aircraft in distant fireballs. With each section of the battlefield it clears of foes, the Crusader’s steady advance brings new targets under its sights, and it continues to unleash destruction with every stride.

upgrades.name: Loyalty
upgrades.description: Building that increases loyalty.
upgrades.flavour: Of course, there is dissent in the Imperium. Even in the Adeptus Mechanicus, hidebound as it is, there is disagreement over the best path to follow. And this is all productive, useful discord. For were there not heretics, there would not the requisite human raw materials to produce servitors and servo-skulls, to set up as examples to craven humanity as to what happens to those who stray from the Omnissiah’s Path.

upgrades.name: LitanyOfTheElectromancer
upgrades.description: Damages target enemy unit. Attacks and cost scales with the amount of Canticles of the Omnissiah units (up to 10).
upgrades.flavour: Summoning the spark of the Machine God’s divinity that burns within them, the Omnissiah’s faithful manifest blazing auras of energy that lay low the unbeliever.

upgrades.name: LucianSpecialisation
upgrades.description: Increases the resource output of non-headquarters buildings of the same type on a tile.
upgrades.flavour: Inside the hollow Forge World of Lucius is a trapped sun, but to the Adeptus Mechanicus that is less interesting than the planet’s specialisations—a unique metal “Luciun” and warp travel. Magi of Lucius encourage specialisation in depth.

upgrades.name: MeleeWeaponBonus
upgrades.description: Increases the armour penetration of melee weapons.
upgrades.flavour: Despite the planet’s specialisation in plasma and shielding devices, so common are Ork invasions on the Forge World of Ryza that the defenders are known for their Ork-esque enthusiasm for melee combat.

upgrades.name: Omnispex
upgrades.description: Allows Skitarii Vanguard to ignore ranged damage reduction.
upgrades.flavour: The omnispex carries a raptor-class machine spirit that can read heat emissions, data signatures, and biological waveforms even at extreme range. Should it be kept focussed for an extended period of time, it will determine the weak points of those it scrutinises and pass them on to its master.

upgrades.name: OnagerDunecrawler
upgrades.description: Doctrina Imperatives walker unit focused on exterminating flying units.
upgrades.flavour: Onager Dunecrawlers decimate the foes of the Skitarii whilst channelling great swathes of battlefield information to their masters high above. Squadrons of these versatile walkers clank to war in long columns that stalk forwards in uncanny unison, clambering over shattered ruins and wading through toxic run-off without breaking stride. The enemies of the Cult Mechanicus have good reason to fear the Dunecrawler, for these ornate monsters are protected by overlapping emanatus force fields, and bear some of the most esoteric and destructive tank-portable weaponry the Tech-Priests can devise.

upgrades.name: OptateRestrictions
upgrades.description: Increases the population limit of Hab Fanes.
upgrades.flavour: The Optates who control Hive City populations have agreed to release breeding restrictions. In practice, this means removal of anaphrodisiacs from ration packs, rather than the construction of new buildings—the existing living spaces just get that much more crowded insteaded…

upgrades.name: ProtectorImperative
upgrades.description: Increases the ranged accuracy, but decreases the melee accuracy of Doctrina Imperatives units. Cost scales with the amount of affected units (up to 10).
upgrades.flavour: The Protector imperative is codified to yield the maximum spectra of hard data. Extra power is fed into narrow-band optics and rangefinders connected directly to the Skitarii’s priority programming as the holy warriors’ guns become an extension of themselves.

upgrades.name: PteraxiiSterylizor
upgrades.description: Doctrina Imperatives infantry unit that can jump over enemies and burn them out of cover.
upgrades.flavour: Sterylizors are eradicators of cybernetic parasite organisms within ships and manufactora, and eagerly unleash the chemical fire of their phosphor torches upon the Machine God’s foes. They descend in flocks from the sky upon membranous wing-packs, their vicious talons primed, eager to see their enemies writhe in flames.

upgrades.name: ReclaimatorProtocols
upgrades.description: Increases the growth rate.
upgrades.flavour: Nothing must be wasted—not a drop of food, not an watt of energy, not a scrap of flesh. Executions are minimised in favour of servitor conversions, prompting an increased vigour in all other activities…

upgrades.name: SerberysSulphurhound
upgrades.description: Doctrina Imperatives infantry unit with flame weapons and an aura that cripples enemy infantry and monstrous creatures.
upgrades.flavour: Sulphurhound cavalry squadrons are aggressive shock troops and line-breakers. The loping, mechanical beasts breathe gouts of incinerating phosphor and disembowel the foe with slashing claws, while the elite Skitarii riders unload incandescent pistol fire as they smash through defence lines, before circling back for survivors.

upgrades.name: Shroudpsalm
upgrades.description: Increases the ranged damage reduction of Canticles of the Omnissiah units. Cost and effectiveness scales with the amount of affected units (up to 10).
upgrades.flavour: Robot, servitor and priest shift their binharic emissions into the visible spectra, the static pouring from their vox-grilles manifesting as an electromagnetic storm that hides them from the foe.

upgrades.name: SicarianInfiltrator
upgrades.description: Doctrina Imperatives infantry unit that specializes in infiltrating enemy lines.
upgrades.flavour: Those hunted by Sicarian Infiltrators will find themselves buffeted by the waves of neurostatic these gangle-limbed stalkers broadcast before them. Robbed of their sight, their hearing, even their sense of smell, such victims are easy targets for the compact tools the Infiltrators use in their deadly work. Should the initial salvo from flechette blaster or stubcarbine not prove sufficient, these merciless killers will dart in to finish the job in close assault.

upgrades.name: SkitariiMarshal
upgrades.description: Doctrina Imperative hero unit that leads the Adeptus Mechanicus into battle.
upgrades.flavour: Marshals lead the maniples and cohorts of Skitarii soldiery. They are veteran warriors of countless crusades, privileged to bear enhanced augmentations. Marshals stand as intermediaries between Skitarii formations and their priestly masters, employing sacred uplinks to refine their warriors’ doctrines closer to holy perfection.

upgrades.name: SkorpiusDisintegrator
upgrades.description: Powerful Doctrina Imperatives front-line tank unit.
upgrades.flavour: Hovering over the ruins of war on a bed of atomised gases, Skorpius Disintegrators are archaic, front-line battle tanks. They surge forward in unstoppable armoured waves and support infantry advances, maintaining blistering salvoes of fire to cripple enemy war engines and sweep aside hordes of lesser foes.

upgrades.name: SkorpiusDunerider
upgrades.description: Doctrina Imperatives transport vehicle.
upgrades.flavour: Skorpius Duneriders enable forge lords to ferry squads of their cyborg infantry onto the front lines, overwhelming the foe through swiftly redeployed weight of numbers. Duneriders sweep onto enemy defences in a cloud of chemical smoke, saturating the area with heavy calibre shot as their payload of warriors disembarks.

upgrades.name: SolarReflectors
upgrades.description: Increases the building energy output for each building in an adjacent tile.
upgrades.flavour: Planning, planning, planning. The Adeptus Mechanicus Magi design each city so it works as a functioning whole, each part supporting the next. Solar reflectors on all structures direct the small amount of energy they capture through Gladius Prime’s storm systems to the nearest Thermo-Exchanger Shrine.

upgrades.name: SoylensAcquisitionTeams
upgrades.description: Increases the building food output for each building in an adjacent tile.
upgrades.flavour: The Reclaimators employ a small number of the undercity’s population in an unsavory role. These Soylens Acquisition Teams are better known as bodysnatchers and they aggressively hunt out the dead (or nearly dead) ensuring that any future rations always have the very freshest soylens protein…

upgrades.name: StygianEnlightenment
upgrades.description: Reduces the research cost.
upgrades.flavour: Some Tech-Priests are more open to studying Xenos technology than others. Only the Forge World of Stygies VIII consistently escapes punishment for these Xenarite tendencies, partly because of their world’s importance, partly because it cripples any attackers. Following their path is certainly a fast way to speed up access to forbidden technologies.

upgrades.name: TechPriestDominus
upgrades.description: Self-reliant Canticles of the Omnissiah hero unit with a scouting ability and damage buffs.
upgrades.flavour: Slithering, floating, stalking with avian gait, the Tech-Priests Dominus scour their surroundings with carrion eagerness. Ever vigilant for lost treasures they can pluck from the corpses of the worlds they conquer, their minds boil hot with data, and their spines are bent under the immense weight of knowledge they have torn from an unwilling universe. Despite their crooked appearance, these warrior magi are amongst the deadliest and most determined of all the Omnissiah’s hunters.

upgrades.name: TechPriestManipulus
upgrades.description: Canticles of the Omnissiah hero unit with powerful support abilities and neutralizing effects.
upgrades.flavour: Among the augmentations of a Tech-Priest Manipulus is a galvanic cell from which they channel powerful charges of the Motive Force. They drain power sources dry and use the energy to overcharge the cells of their warriors’ armaments, all while defending their divine work with blasts from their own arcane weapons.

upgrades.name: TerranGeneralism
upgrades.description: Removes the resource output penalty of non-headquarters buildings of differing types on a tile.
upgrades.flavour: Though many Forge Worlds have specialised towards particular needs and act as independent empires within the human sphere, it’s worth remembering that most Tech-Priests are generalists, loyally supporting the Imperium in its drive to the stars—and following the orders of Earth as much as Mars.

upgrades.name: ThermoExchangeEfficiency
upgrades.description: Increases the bonus output of Power Surge.
upgrades.flavour: Paradoxically, slowing down the inputs to the ThermoExchanger and feeding the plasma through a second set of heat couplings and condensers can stretch the length of time it can operate beyond nominal goals—or at least reduce the amount of lives lost and repairs needed.

upgrades.name: TriplexNecessity
upgrades.description: Increases the building ore output for each building in an adjacent tile.
upgrades.flavour: Following new designs discovered on Triplex Phall, during the construction of new structures, care is taken to explore any subterranean areas and map out any potential ore veins. If a Haemotrope Reactor, its plasma can be directed down these prepared routes to more efficiently extract the ore.

upgrades.name: TwinLinkedIcarusAutocannon
upgrades.description: Grants Knight Crusaders a Twin-Linked Icarus Autocannon.
upgrades.flavour: The Icarus arrays used by the Adeptus Mechanicus fill the sky with inescapable death. Comprising a twin Icarus autocannon with skyscryer lenses, a gatling rocket launcher that fires whole salvoes of flak and an armour-piercing missile launcher, its combined firepower can shred an entire squadron of enemy fighters.

upgrades.name: Vehicles
upgrades.description: Building that produces ground vehicles as well as generates food, ore and influence.
upgrades.flavour: A Tech-Priest manufactorum is leagues ahead of its standard Imperial equivalent. Not technologically, of course—the Cult Mechanicus considers it more important to safeguard the technology they have and improving it is a Xenarite heresy that only Cawl himself might consider. Instead this building has superior rituals, unguents, chants, libations and so forth.

upgrades.name: VoicesInTheCode
upgrades.description: Increases the morale loss of enemy units adjacent to Sicarian Infiltrators.
upgrades.flavour: Closing with a Sicarian Infiltrator is a mistake—their augmented craniums broadcast a brutally disruptive audiovisual assault, causing enemies to fall deafened and blinded; battles are often decided before even a single kill is confirmed.

upgrades.name: XenariteAcceptance
upgrades.description: Increases the flat amount of research gained from outposts.
upgrades.flavour: It seems the Xenarite Tech-Priests from Stygies VIII are having their way on Gladius Prime too—setting up observation units and drones at every Outpost to understand the Xenos better. The practical applications in terms of research are immediately obvious…
